basics.name: Jiazhe Chen
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: A graduate student at Northeastern University, majoring in Computer Science.

work.name: Seelove Technology
work.summary: Vue.js, Three.js, Alibaba Cloud, Figma, SQL, Git
highlights: Designed wireframes & prototypes with Figma, developed interactive web platform user interfaces using Vue.js, and collaborated with team members to showcase VR/XR features on reuseable components.
Integrated 3D model visualization into the web-end player using Three.js to ensure an immersive experience for wedding ceremonies held by users.

work.name: Kanahato K.K.
highlights: Ensured enterprise-level data security, high availability and efficient CRUD operations by utilizing a hybrid database structure using AWS S3 and DynamoDB for static assets and dynamic resources in multiple languages.
Built efficient CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Action, AWS SES and AWS Lambda for automated tasks, build and deployment processes, decreasing average deployment workload by 75%.

Optimized data architecture for scalable back-end APIs, secured user authentication and authorization control and modern UI/UX flow with animated Material Design components to create consistent user experience.

work.name: Lilith Games
highlights: Designed a new data model to estimate weights for players of various payment levels based on purchase preferences using Python Scikit-learn, increasing the accuracy of Facebook advertising on potential new players by 15%.
Streamlined data pipelines when discovering the front-load effect on in-game purchase recommendation pop-ups by conducting an A/B test on more than 1M new users using Apache Hive-SQL.

Created and maintained automated interactive Tableau dashboards as a analysis reporting tool for new feature updates and in-game events to ensure accurate and thorough data collection on a daily basis.

courses: Courses: Web Development, Mobile Application Development

education.institution: East China University of Poli-Science & Law

projects.name: Travel Planning Web Application
highlights: Developed a full-stack social media web application on top of Google Maps API, where users can interact and collaborate on travel attractions and travel plans by combining features from various competitors in the industry.

Devised web application architecture in form of a RESTful API and minimized the development efforts by reusing ReactJS components, NodeJS as a back-end system and a MongoDB database for NoSQL data models.
Conducted integration tests on all feature components to eliminate bugs and unexpected behaviors during the development lifecycle and delivered a functional build using Git on Netlify.

projects.name: Collaborative Painting Application
highlights: Conceptualized a server-level database that allows clients to synchronize actions performed by others in the network, undo their actions, and save/load current painting work to local devices.
Built server functionalities such as dataflow broadcasting, user reconnection, and action history log in an Agile style.

projects.name: Spelling Battle Game
highlights: Designed the high-level concepts of an Android game that allows users to develop word spelling skills with friends.
Implemented object classes using Model-View-Control pattern to connect mobile clients with Firebase in real-time.

Deployed a Java material design GUI and a data model for word cards with customized animation and an automated user authentication component that allows users to sign-up, login/out, and change credentials.

awards.title: Distinguished Undergraduate Thesis
awards.awarder: East China University of Poli-Science & Law
